info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 2:57PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact locations along and north of Highway 89 near Jerome and Cottonwood through 330 PM MST... At 256 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clarkdale, or 13 miles west of Sedona, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sedona, Clarkdale, Verde Village, Bridgeport, Cottonwood, Dead Horse Ranch State Park and Tuzigoot National Monument. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 207 and 208. State Route 89A between mile markers 347 and 371. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
